title: Our Solar System
narration: Embark on an incredible journey through our solar system We will explore the planets moons and other celestial bodies that orbit our star the Sun. Get ready to discover the wonders of space

title: The Sun: Our Star
content:
The center of our solar system.
Provides light and heat.
A giant ball of hot gas.
narration: At the heart of our solar system lies the Sun a massive star that provides light and heat to all the planets. It is a giant ball of hot gas primarily hydrogen and helium undergoing nuclear fusion. Without the Sun life as we know it wouldn't exist on Earth.

title: The Inner Planets
content:
Mercury: The closest planet to the Sun.
Venus: A hot, cloudy planet.
Earth: Our home, the only known planet to support life.
Mars: The "Red Planet," with potential for past life.
image_desc: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars planets. Type: illustration
narration: Let's explore the inner planets Mercury Venus Earth and Mars. Mercury the closest is a small rocky world. Venus is known for its thick toxic atmosphere and scorching temperatures. Earth our home is unique for its abundant water and diverse life. Finally Mars the Red Planet has intrigued scientists with its potential for past or present microbial life.

title: The Outer Planets
content:
Jupiter: The largest planet, a gas giant.
Saturn: Known for its beautiful rings.
Uranus: An ice giant that rotates on its side.
Neptune: A cold, blue planet farthest from the Sun.
image_desc: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune planets. Type: illustration
narration: Now let's venture to the outer planets Jupiter Saturn Uranus and Neptune. Jupiter the largest is a gas giant with a swirling atmosphere and many moons. Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system composed of ice and rock particles. Uranus is an ice giant that rotates on its side. Finally Neptune the farthest planet is a cold blue world with strong winds.

title: Beyond the Planets
content: Caption: The Kuiper Belt and Oort Cloud contain icy bodies and comets.
image_desc: Kuiper belt, Oort cloud, comets. Type: illustration
narration: Beyond Neptune lies the Kuiper Belt a region containing icy bodies including Pluto now classified as a dwarf planet. Even farther out is the Oort Cloud a theoretical sphere surrounding the solar system believed to be the source of many comets. These distant regions hold clues to the formation of our solar system.
